Dear Kathleen Nikesch:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 11/17/2023. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective
action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
CPA Rule 400.12327 Special evaluation
(6) An agency shall do all the following:
(b) Inform the foster parent, in writing, that the foster
parent has a right to have his or her written response
included as an attachment to the report required by
subrule (5) of this rule.
Two of the three special evaluations reviewed did not include adequate
documentation to confirm the foster parents were informed in writing that they
could have their written response to the report included as an addendum to the
report.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Expectations regarding Medical Passports were discussed.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• None

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There was 1 incident of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period. The foster parent improperly attempted to restrain the youth from truanting
the foster home. The youth was subsequently removed from the home. A corrective
action plan was required and the license was voluntarily relinquished following the
completion of a special evaluation.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows. A
corrective action plan was completed for the noncompliance identified as a part of
the interim evaluation completed 1/25/2023. Areas identified in noncompliance
were Rules 324(4)(d), and 509(3). The CAP was approved 4/4/2023 and none of
these issues were identified in noncompliance as a part of this renewal evaluation.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment was a review of the corrective action plan
submitted for the interim evaluation completed 1/25/2023. A review of the
agency's key performance indicators was also included as a part of the
assessment.
Financial Overview
The agency has adequate financial resources to ensure the appropriate care of
youth and provide adequate support services.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Child Welfare staff participated in entrance and exit conferences. No concerns
were indicated.
The youth interviews with the analyst were positive in nature and indicated
adequate support and services are being provided.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency is well maintained, and the storage of records is in compliance with
licensing requirements.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
The analyst identified one safety alert. Resolution of the alert was received 9/27/2023
and approved 10/01/2023. The resolution was a home visit to the caretakers to
confirm the children's wellbeing.

VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
